        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1422250: Security: Race Condition UAF in evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1422250: Security: Race Condition UAF in evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      lm096...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3761508586" title="lm096...@gmail.com"><!---->lm096...@gmail.com<!----></a>

            Issue 1422250: Security: Race Condition UAF in evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

          <h1>
            
            Issue 1422250: Security: Race Condition UAF in evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Mar 7, 2023, 9:40 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 7, 2023)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ioctl$EVDI_CONNECT will call *evdi_painter_connect_ioctl* to connect/disconnect painter. if *cmd->connected* is false, evdi_painter_disconnect will be called. *painter->scanout_fb* will be put[1] under *painter->lock*, that is fine. But *evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify* will access *painter->scanout_fb->base* without *painter->lock* locked, there may be a race condition UAF[3].<span class="line"><!---->ioctl$EVDI_CONNECT will call *evdi_painter_connect_ioctl* to connect/disconnect painter. if *cmd-&gt;connected* is false, evdi_painter_disconnect will be called. *painter-&gt;scanout_fb* will be put[1] under *painter-&gt;lock*, that is fine. But *evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify* will access *painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base* without *painter-&gt;lock* locked, there may be a race condition UAF[3].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int evdi_painter_disconnect(struct evdi_device *evdi,<span class="line"><!---->static int evdi_painter_disconnect(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>        struct drm_file *file)<span class="line"><!---->        struct drm_file *file)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi->painter;<span class="line"><!---->        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi-&gt;painter;<!----></span><br>        char buf[100];<span class="line"><!---->        char buf[100];<!----></span><br><br>        EVDI_CHECKPT();<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_CHECKPT();<!----></span><br><br>        painter_lock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->        painter_lock(painter);<!----></span><br><br>        if (file != painter->drm_filp) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (file != painter-&gt;drm_filp) {<!----></span><br>                painter_unlock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->                painter_unlock(painter);<!----></span><br>                return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->                return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        if (painter->scanout_fb) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter-&gt;scanout_fb) {<!----></span><br>                drm_framebuffer_put(&painter->scanout_fb->base);        // [1]<span class="line"><!---->                drm_framebuffer_put(&amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base);        // [1]<!----></span><br>                painter->scanout_fb = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->                painter-&gt;scanout_fb = NULL;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        ......<span class="line"><!---->        ......<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<span class="line"><!---->void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>                                      struct drm_display_mode *new_mode)<span class="line"><!---->                                      struct drm_display_mode *new_mode)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi->painter;<span class="line"><!---->        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi-&gt;painter;<!----></span><br>        struct drm_framebuffer *fb;<span class="line"><!---->        struct drm_framebuffer *fb;<!----></span><br>        int bits_per_pixel;<span class="line"><!---->        int bits_per_pixel;<!----></span><br>        uint32_t pixel_format;<span class="line"><!---->        uint32_t pixel_format;<!----></span><br>        char buf[100];<span class="line"><!---->        char buf[100];<!----></span><br><br>        if (painter == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br><br>        fb = &painter->scanout_fb->base;            // [2]<span class="line"><!---->        fb = &amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base;            // [2]<!----></span><br>        if (fb == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (fb == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br><br>        bits_per_pixel = fb->format->cpp[0] * 8;    // [3]<span class="line"><!---->        bits_per_pixel = fb-&gt;format-&gt;cpp[0] * 8;    // [3]<!----></span><br>        pixel_format = fb->format->format;<span class="line"><!---->        pixel_format = fb-&gt;format-&gt;format;<!----></span><br><br><br>        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<span class="line"><!---->        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<!----></span><br>        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<!----></span><br>                   evdi->dev_index, new_mode->hdisplay, new_mode->vdisplay,<span class="line"><!---->                   evdi-&gt;dev_index, new_mode-&gt;hdisplay, new_mode-&gt;vdisplay,<!----></span><br>                   drm_mode_vrefresh(new_mode), bits_per_pixel, buf);<span class="line"><!---->                   drm_mode_vrefresh(new_mode), bits_per_pixel, buf);<!----></span><br><br>        evdi_painter_send_mode_changed(painter,<span class="line"><!---->        evdi_painter_send_mode_changed(painter,<!----></span><br>                                       new_mode,<span class="line"><!---->                                       new_mode,<!----></span><br>                                       bits_per_pixel,<span class="line"><!---->                                       bits_per_pixel,<!----></span><br>                                       pixel_format);<span class="line"><!---->                                       pixel_format);<!----></span><br>        painter->needs_full_modeset = false;<span class="line"><!---->        painter-&gt;needs_full_modeset = false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>evdi_painter_disconnect             |    evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify<span class="line"><!---->evdi_painter_disconnect             |    evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify<!----></span><br>    painter_unlock                  |        fb = &painter->scanout_fb->base; [2]<span class="line"><!---->    painter_unlock                  |        fb = &amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base; [2]<!----></span><br>        drm_framebuffer_put [1]     |<span class="line"><!---->        drm_framebuffer_put [1]     |<!----></span><br>                                    |            bits_per_pixel = fb->format->cpp[0] * 8; [3] <---------UAF<span class="line"><!---->                                    |            bits_per_pixel = fb-&gt;format-&gt;cpp[0] * 8; [3] &lt;---------UAF<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.10/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c;drc=2a20b22cd107d774fb72ca50660ce11b9d5ef22b;l=912<a <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.10/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c;drc=2a20b22cd107d774fb72ca50660ce11b9d5ef22b;l=741<a <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.10/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c;drc=2a20b22cd107d774fb72ca50660ce11b9d5ef22b;l=745<a dev<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>This issue is discovered by manual code review, I will try to construct a poc to reproduce it.<span PATCH SUGGESTION<span class="line"><!---->FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<!----></span><br>I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<span class="line"><!---->I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c b/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c<span class="line"><!---->diff --git +738,18 @@ void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>        if (painter == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter == NULL)<!----></span><br> NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (fb == NULL)<!----></span><br>+       {<span class="line"><!---->+       {<!----></span><br>+               painter_unlock(painter);<span         The proposed fix is fine. It is working for me on CrOS and Linux.<span class="line"><!---->The proposed fix is fine. It is working for me on CrOS and Linux.<!----></span><br><br>However I am not sure if it is feasable to use that vulnerability as to do it you have to do what compositor is doing, and this is only possible when you are have drm master of the device.<span class="line"><!---->However I am not sure if it is feasable to use that vulnerability as to do it you have to do what compositor is doing, and this is only possible when you are have drm master of the device.<!----></span><br>Usually system compositor like xserver/wayland/Chrome has drm master so malicious app have to do it before system compositor will attempt to open evdi device. If i recall corectly you need root as well to get open device as drm master.<span class="line"><!---->Usually system compositor like xserver/wayland/Chrome has drm master so malicious app have to do it before system compositor will attempt to open evdi device.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1422250#c45">Comment 45<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

        Re: #18, I think the attack path here is: compromise renderer → compromise browser process → compromise kernel via this bug. Is that right? I.e. you can't use this bug from within a renderer, you have to get into the browser process? If that is right, then I think this bug is correctly rated Medium.<span class="line"><!---->Re: #18, I think the attack path here is: compromise renderer → compromise browser process → compromise kernel via this bug. Is that right? I.e. you can't use this bug from within a renderer, you have to get into the browser process? If that is right, then I think this bug is correctly rated Medium.<!----></span><br><br>If I'm wrong, and you *can* get to it directly from a renderer, then it'd be High, I think.<span class="line"><!---->If I'm wrong, and you *can* get to it directly from a renderer, then it'd be High, I think.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you, lm0963hack! :)<span class="line"><!---->Thank you, lm0963hack! :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

    line-height: 1.6;
  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 7, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 7, 2023)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 7, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ioctl$EVDI_CONNECT will call *evdi_painter_connect_ioctl* to connect/disconnect painter. if *cmd->connected* is false, evdi_painter_disconnect will be called. *painter->scanout_fb* will be put[1] under *painter->lock*, that is fine. But *evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify* will access *painter->scanout_fb->base* without *painter->lock* locked, there may be a race condition UAF[3].<span class="line"><!---->ioctl$EVDI_CONNECT will call *evdi_painter_connect_ioctl* to connect/disconnect painter. if *cmd-&gt;connected* is false, evdi_painter_disconnect will be called. *painter-&gt;scanout_fb* will be put[1] under *painter-&gt;lock*, that is fine. But *evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify* will access *painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base* without *painter-&gt;lock* locked, there may be a race condition UAF[3].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int evdi_painter_disconnect(struct evdi_device *evdi,<span class="line"><!---->static int evdi_painter_disconnect(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>        struct drm_file *file)<span class="line"><!---->        struct drm_file *file)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi->painter;<span class="line"><!---->        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi-&gt;painter;<!----></span><br>        char buf[100];<span class="line"><!---->        char buf[100];<!----></span><br><br>        EVDI_CHECKPT();<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_CHECKPT();<!----></span><br><br>        painter_lock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->        painter_lock(painter);<!----></span><br><br>        if (file != painter->drm_filp) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (file != painter-&gt;drm_filp) {<!----></span><br>                painter_unlock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->                painter_unlock(painter);<!----></span><br>                return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->                return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        if (painter->scanout_fb) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter-&gt;scanout_fb) {<!----></span><br>                drm_framebuffer_put(&painter->scanout_fb->base);        // [1]<span class="line"><!---->                drm_framebuffer_put(&amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base);        // [1]<!----></span><br>                painter->scanout_fb = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->                painter-&gt;scanout_fb = NULL;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        ......<span class="line"><!---->        ......<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<span class="line"><!---->void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>                                      struct drm_display_mode *new_mode)<span class="line"><!---->                                      struct drm_display_mode *new_mode)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi->painter;<span class="line"><!---->        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi-&gt;painter;<!----></span><br>        struct drm_framebuffer *fb;<span class="line"><!---->        struct drm_framebuffer *fb;<!----></span><br>        int bits_per_pixel;<span class="line"><!---->        int bits_per_pixel;<!----></span><br>        uint32_t pixel_format;<span class="line"><!---->        uint32_t pixel_format;<!----></span><br>        char buf[100];<span class="line"><!---->        char buf[100];<!----></span><br><br>        if (painter == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br><br>        fb = &painter->scanout_fb->base;            // [2]<span class="line"><!---->        fb = &amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base;            // [2]<!----></span><br>        if (fb == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (fb == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br><br>        bits_per_pixel = fb->format->cpp[0] * 8;    // [3]<span class="line"><!---->        bits_per_pixel = fb-&gt;format-&gt;cpp[0] * 8;    // [3]<!----></span><br>        pixel_format = fb->format->format;<span class="line"><!---->        pixel_format = fb-&gt;format-&gt;format;<!----></span><br><br><br>        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<span class="line"><!---->        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<!----></span><br>        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<!----></span><br>                   evdi->dev_index, new_mode->hdisplay, new_mode->vdisplay,<span class="line"><!---->                   evdi-&gt;dev_index, new_mode-&gt;hdisplay, new_mode-&gt;vdisplay,<!----></span><br>         The proposed fix is fine. It is working for me on CrOS and Linux.<span class="line"><!---->The proposed fix is fine. It is working for me on CrOS and Linux.<!----></span><br><br>However I am not sure if it is feasable to use that vulnerability as to do it you have to do what compositor is doing, and this is only possible when you are have drm master of the device.<span class="line"><!---->However I am not sure if it is feasable to use that vulnerability as to do it you have to do what compositor is doing, and this is only possible when you are have drm master of the device.<!----></span><br>Usually system compositor like xserver/wayland/Chrome has drm master so malicious app have to do it before system compositor will attempt to open evdi device. If i recall corectly you need root as well to get open device as drm master.<span class="line"><!---->Usually system compositor like xserver/wayland/Chrome has drm master so malicious app have to do it before system compositor will attempt to open evdi device.         Re: #18, I think the attack path here is: compromise renderer → compromise browser process → compromise kernel via this bug. Is that right? I.e. you can't use this bug from within a renderer, you have to get into the browser process? If that is right, then I think this bug is correctly rated Medium.<span class="line"><!---->Re: #18, I think the attack path here is: compromise renderer → compromise browser process → compromise kernel via this bug. Is that right? I.e. you can't use this bug from within a renderer, you have to get into the browser process? If that is right, then I think this bug is correctly rated Medium.<!----></span><br><br>If I'm wrong, and you *can* get to it directly from a renderer, then it'd be High, I think.<span class="line"><!---->If I'm wrong, and you *can* get to it directly from a renderer, then it'd be High, I think.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you, lm0963hack! :)<span class="line"><!---->Thank you, lm0963hack! :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

        for LitElement.

            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>
        
        <table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody></table>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>
        
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1422250: Security: Race Condition UAF in evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify
          <h1>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ioctl$EVDI_CONNECT will call *evdi_painter_connect_ioctl* to connect/disconnect painter. if *cmd->connected* is false, evdi_painter_disconnect will be called. *painter->scanout_fb* will be put[1] under *painter->lock*, that is fine. But *evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify* will access *painter->scanout_fb->base* without *painter->lock* locked, there may be a race condition UAF[3].<span class="line"><!---->ioctl$EVDI_CONNECT will call *evdi_painter_connect_ioctl* to connect/disconnect painter. if *cmd-&gt;connected* is false, evdi_painter_disconnect will be called. *painter-&gt;scanout_fb* will be put[1] under *painter-&gt;lock*, that is fine. But *evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify* will access *painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base* without *painter-&gt;lock* locked, there may be a race condition UAF[3].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int evdi_painter_disconnect(struct evdi_device *evdi,<span class="line"><!---->static int evdi_painter_disconnect(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>        struct drm_file *file)<span class="line"><!---->        struct drm_file *file)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi->painter;<span class="line"><!---->        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi-&gt;painter;<!----></span><br>        char buf[100];<span class="line"><!---->        char buf[100];<!----></span><br><br>        EVDI_CHECKPT();<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_CHECKPT();<!----></span><br><br>        painter_lock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->        painter_lock(painter);<!----></span><br><br>        if (file != painter->drm_filp) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (file != painter-&gt;drm_filp) {<!----></span><br>                painter_unlock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->                painter_unlock(painter);<!----></span><br>                return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->                return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        if (painter->scanout_fb) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter-&gt;scanout_fb) {<!----></span><br>                drm_framebuffer_put(&painter->scanout_fb->base);        // [1]<span class="line"><!---->                drm_framebuffer_put(&amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base);        // [1]<!----></span><br>                painter->scanout_fb = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->                painter-&gt;scanout_fb = NULL;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        ......<span class="line"><!---->        ......<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<span class="line"><!---->void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>                                      struct drm_display_mode *new_mode)<span class="line"><!---->                                      struct drm_display_mode *new_mode)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi->painter;<span class="line"><!---->        struct evdi_painter *painter = evdi-&gt;painter;<!----></span><br>        struct drm_framebuffer *fb;<span class="line"><!---->        struct drm_framebuffer *fb;<!----></span><br>        int bits_per_pixel;<span class="line"><!---->        int bits_per_pixel;<!----></span><br>        uint32_t pixel_format;<span class="line"><!---->        uint32_t pixel_format;<!----></span><br>        char buf[100];<span class="line"><!---->        char buf[100];<!----></span><br><br>        if (painter == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br><br>        fb = &painter->scanout_fb->base;            // [2]<span class="line"><!---->        fb = &amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base;            // [2]<!----></span><br>        if (fb == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (fb == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br><br>        bits_per_pixel = fb->format->cpp[0] * 8;    // [3]<span class="line"><!---->        bits_per_pixel = fb-&gt;format-&gt;cpp[0] * 8;    // [3]<!----></span><br>        pixel_format = fb->format->format;<span class="line"><!---->        pixel_format = fb-&gt;format-&gt;format;<!----></span><br><br><br>        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<span class="line"><!---->        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<!----></span><br>        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<!----></span><br>                   evdi->dev_index, new_mode->hdisplay, new_mode->vdisplay,<span class="line"><!---->                   evdi-&gt;dev_index, new_mode-&gt;hdisplay, new_mode-&gt;vdisplay,<!----></span><br>                   drm_mode_vrefresh(new_mode), bits_per_pixel, buf);<span class="line"><!---->                   drm_mode_vrefresh(new_mode), bits_per_pixel, buf);<!----></span><br><br>        evdi_painter_send_mode_changed(painter,<span class="line"><!---->        evdi_painter_send_mode_changed(painter,<!----></span><br>                                       new_mode,<span class="line"><!---->                                       new_mode,<!----></span><br>                                       bits_per_pixel,<span class="line"><!---->                                       bits_per_pixel,<!----></span><br>                                       pixel_format);<span class="line"><!---->                                       pixel_format);<!----></span><br>        painter->needs_full_modeset = false;<span class="line"><!---->        painter-&gt;needs_full_modeset = false;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>evdi_painter_disconnect             |    evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify<span class="line"><!---->evdi_painter_disconnect             |    evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify<!----></span><br>    painter_unlock                  |        fb = &painter->scanout_fb->base; [2]<span class="line"><!---->    painter_unlock                  |        fb = &amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base; [2]<!----></span><br>        drm_framebuffer_put [1]     |<span class="line"><!---->        drm_framebuffer_put [1]     |<!----></span><br>                                    |            bits_per_pixel = fb->format->cpp[0] * 8; [3] <---------UAF<span class="line"><!---->                                    |            bits_per_pixel = fb-&gt;format-&gt;cpp[0] * 8; [3] &lt;---------UAF<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.10/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c;drc=2a20b22cd107d774fb72ca50660ce11b9d5ef22b;l=912<a PATCH SUGGESTION<span class="line"><!---->FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<!----></span><br>I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<span class="line"><!---->I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c b/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c b/drivers/gpu/drm/evdi/evdi_painter.c<!----></span><br>index 8e70f495111a..f390bf11a706 100644<span class="line"><!---->index 8e70f495111a..f390bf11a706 +738,18 @@ void evdi_painter_mode_changed_notify(struct evdi_device *evdi,<!----></span><br>        if (painter == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (painter == NULL)<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>+       painter_lock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->+       painter_lock(painter);<!----></span><br>        fb = &painter->scanout_fb->base;<span class="line"><!---->        fb = &amp;painter-&gt;scanout_fb-&gt;base;<!----></span><br>        if (fb == NULL)<span class="line"><!---->        if (fb == NULL)<!----></span><br>+       {<span class="line"><!---->+       {<!----></span><br>+               painter_unlock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->+               painter_unlock(painter);<!----></span><br>                return;<span class="line"><!---->                return;<!----></span><br>+       }<span class="line"><!---->+       }<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>        bits_per_pixel = fb->format->cpp[0] * 8;<span class="line"><!---->        bits_per_pixel = fb-&gt;format-&gt;cpp[0] * 8;<!----></span><br>        pixel_format = fb->format->format;<span class="line"><!---->        pixel_format = fb-&gt;format-&gt;format;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>+       painter_unlock(painter);<span class="line"><!---->+       painter_unlock(painter);<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<span class="line"><!---->        evdi_log_pixel_format(pixel_format, buf, sizeof(buf));<!----></span><br>        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<span class="line"><!---->        EVDI_INFO("(card%d) Notifying mode changed: %dx%d@%d; bpp %d; %s",<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>

        The proposed fix is fine. It is working for me on CrOS and Linux.<span class="line"><!---->The proposed fix is fine. It is working for me on CrOS and Linux.<!----></span><br><br>However I am not sure if it is feasable to use that vulnerability as to do it you have to do what compositor is doing, and this is only possible when you are have drm master of the device.<span class="line"><!---->However I am not sure if it is feasable to use that vulnerability as to do it you have to do what compositor is doing, and this is only possible when you are have drm master of the device.<!----></span><br>Usually system compositor like xserver/wayland/Chrome has drm master so malicious app have to do it before system compositor will attempt to open evdi device. If i recall corectly you need root as well to get open device as drm master.<span class="line"><!---->Usually system compositor like xserver/wayland/Chrome has drm master so malicious app have to do it before system compositor will attempt to open evdi device. If i recall corectly you need root as well to get open device as drm master.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        robdclark: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 29 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->robdclark: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 29 days. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         Re: #18, I think the attack path here is: compromise renderer → compromise browser process → compromise kernel via this bug. Is that right? I.e. you can't use this bug from within a renderer, you have to get into the browser process? If that is right, then I think this bug is correctly rated Medium.<span class="line"><!---->Re: #18, I think the attack path here is: compromise renderer → compromise browser process → compromise kernel via this bug. Is that right? I.e. you can't use this bug from within a renderer, you have to get into the browser process? If that is right, then I think this bug is correctly rated Medium.<!----></span><br><br>If I'm wrong, and you *can* get to it directly from a renderer, then it'd be High, I think.<span class="line"><!---->If I'm wrong, and you *can* get to it directly from a renderer, then it'd be High, I think.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you, lm0963hack! :)<span class="line"><!---->Thank you, lm0963hack! :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
